intro: Trichosporum tetraquetrum, commonly known as the four-sided beard moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems covered with dense, appressed leaves that are often pale green to reddish in color. The leaves are typically four-sided in cross-section, giving the plant its scientific name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Trichosporum tetraquetrum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for small invertebrates.
